1.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, And lay up my commandments with thee;

2.text: So that thou make thine ear attend unto wisdom, And thy heart incline to discernment;

3.text: Yea, if thou call for understanding, And lift up thy voice for discernment;

4.text: If thou seek her as silver, And search for her as for hid treasures;

5.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, And find the knowledge of God.

6.text: For the LORD giveth wisdom, Out of His mouth cometh knowledge and discernment;

7.text: He layeth up sound wisdom for the upright, He is a shield to them that walk in integrity;

8.text: That He may guard the paths of justice, And preserve the way of His godly ones.

9.text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness and justice, And equity, yea, every good path.

10.text: For wisdom shall enter into thy heart, And knowledge shall be pleasant unto thy soul;

11.text: Discretion shall watch over thee, Discernment shall guard thee;

12.text: To deliver thee from the way of evil, From the men that speak froward things;

13.text: Who leave the paths of uprightness, To walk in the ways of darkness;

14.text: Who rejoice to do evil, And delight in the frowardness of evil;

15.text: Who are crooked in their ways, And perverse in their paths;

16.text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, Even from the alien woman that maketh smooth her words;

17.text: That forsaketh the lord of her youth, And forgetteth the covenant of her God.

18.text: For her house sinketh down unto death, And her paths unto the shades;

19.text: None that go unto her return, Neither do they attain unto the paths of life;

20.text: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, And keep the paths of the righteous.

21.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, And the whole-hearted shall remain in it.

22.text: But the wicked shall be cut off from the land, And the faithless shall be plucked up out of it.
